headline: Media companies have 'moral obligation' to uphold free speech
summary: Jimmy Kimmel will return to his ABC late night spot on Tuesday after facing backlash comments tied to the shooting death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. ABC parent company Disney (DIS) was under pressure from broadcast providers and regulators, raising a larger question about what this moment means for the free speech of artists and major media networks. Plex CEO Keith Valory underlines the importance of media companies and streamers maintaining their independence and freedom of expression. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Netflix (NFLX): Assessing Valuation as Growth Slows After a Year of Strong Returns
summary: Netflix (NFLX) has been drawing investor attention once again, this time without any splashy AI announcements or headline-grabbing product launches. The latest move in the stock price may seem puzzling at first glance, but it is exactly these quiet stretches that tend to get long-term investors wondering what comes next. With entertainment and streaming trends constantly shifting, every fluctuation can signal a change in how the market is evaluating Netflix’s future potential. Looking at the...

headline: Silicon Valley Confusion Over H-1B Visa Spurs Tech Plunge in India
summary: Ultimately, the new fee will apply to H-1Bs when they are first granted, and not to existing visas or any future renewals.

headline: AB InBev teams with Netflix for co-branded campaigns around live events
summary: The mutliyear partnership includes consumer activations, limited-edition packaging, digital promotions and other efforts.
